item.title: 英国创下热量和日照新纪录，推动太阳能发电发展
item.description: 英国刚刚度过了有记录以来最温暖、阳光最充足的一年。【原文：The UK just wrapped the warmest and sunniest year ever recorded.】

item.title: 2026 年我们关注的主要气候趋势
item.description: 新年快乐（加一天）！今天的通讯是您今年余下时间的气候小抄。【原文：Happy New Year (plus one day)! Today’s newsletter is your climate cheat sheet for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 南非总统拉马福萨任命新的总统气候委员会成员
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）已任命 25 人担任该国气候机构未来五年的专员。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa has appointed 25 people to serve as commissioners on the country’s climate body for the next five years.】

item.title: 银行从绿色债券中获得的费用高于化石燃料债务
item.description: 华尔街最大的银行为绿色项目提供融资所赚的钱连续第四年超过了与化石燃料公司合作所赚的钱，尽管它们一直面临着撤出这一业务的压力。【原文：Wall Street’s biggest banks made more money financing green projects than they did from working with fossil fuel companies for a fourth straight year, even as they faced ongoing pressure to pull back from the business.】

item.title: 影响 2026 年气候的 14 个全球趋势
item.description:
从全球电动汽车市场的分裂到中国如何将气候因素纳入其五年计划，这些都是彭博新闻社记者正在关注的主题。【原文：

From a split in the global electric vehicle market to how China will factor climate into its five-year plan, these are the themes Bloomberg News reporters are watching.

】

item.title: 奥尔斯特德对特朗普暂停风力发电场提出法律挑战
item.description: Orsted A/S 对特朗普政府暂停租用罗德岛附近即将完工的风力发电项目提出了法律挑战。【原文：Orsted A/S has filed a legal challenge against the Trump administration’s move to suspend the lease of a wind project that’s near completion off Rhode Island.】

item.title: 丰富还是充足？寻求更美好的气候未来
item.description:
作家金-斯坦利-罗宾逊（Kim Stanley Robinson）参加《零点播报》（Zero podcast）节目，讨论如何在气候政策倒退的情况下克服虚无主义。【原文：

Author Kim Stanley Robinson joins the Zero podcast to discuss how to overcome nihilism in the face of climate policy rollbacks.

】

item.title: 中国称欧盟征收碳边境税不公平，警告将采取反制措施
item.description: 中国商务部周四发表声明称，欧盟征收碳边境税是 "不公平 "和 "歧视性的"，并誓言将采取反制措施捍卫国家利益。【原文：The European Union’s carbon border levy is “unfair” and “discriminatory,” China’s Ministry of Commerce said in a statement on Thursday, vowing to take countermeasures to defend the country’s interests.】

item.title: 蜜蜂可能为生物燃料付出的代价
item.description:
旨在减少航空旅行碳足迹的经济激励措施可能会加速破坏对授粉至关重要的草原。【原文：

Financial incentives to shrink the carbon footprint of air travel could turbocharge the destruction of grasslands critical to pollination.

】

item.title: 2025 年彭博绿色报道之最
item.description: 一年的最后一天是反思的时刻。回顾 2025 年，在气候方面有很多事情值得总结。今天的时事通讯回顾了影响气候和能源故事的一些宏观趋势。【原文：The last day of the year is a time for reflection. Looking back on 2025, there was a lot to take in when it comes to the climate. Today’s newsletter looks back on some of the macro trends that shaped the climate and energy story.】

item.title: 德里多年来最糟糕的空气激发愤怒，莫迪政党面临考验
item.description: 今年冬天，印度首都创下了近十年来最严重的污染记录，引发了罕见的公众抗议，总理纳伦德拉-莫迪的政党也因处理空气质量紧急情况而遭到批评。【原文：India’s capital recorded its worst pollution in nearly a decade this winter, sparking rare public protests and criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party over its handling of the air quality emergency.】

item.title: 纽约将在寒流中迎来 2026 年，而洛杉矶将迎来更多降雨
item.description: 据预测，纽约将出现低温天气，并可能下雪，因此想要在纽约时代广场庆祝新年的狂欢者需要穿得严严实实。【原文：Revelers wanting to celebrate the new year in New York’s Times Square will need to bundle up as freezing temperatures and possible snow is forecast for the city.】

item.title: 投资经理认真对待野火灾害债券
item.description: 就在几年前，与火灾风险相关的巨灾债券还被认为难以建立模型。但在 2025 年，投资经理们开始真正感兴趣。在今天的时事通讯中，我们将探讨这些金融工具如何在重大灾害发生时帮助人们和政府恢复经济。【原文：Catastrophe bonds linked to fire risk were seen as too difficult to model just a few years ago. But 2025 was the year when investment managers started taking a real interest. In today’s newsletter, we look at how these financial instruments are helping people and governments recover when major disasters strike.】

item.title: 赞比亚和津巴布韦将为价值 42 亿美元的水电项目捐款
item.description: 赞比亚和津巴布韦同意各出资 2.2 亿美元，用于建设耗资 42 亿美元的巴托卡峡谷水电站，该水电站将为两国供电。【原文：Zambia and Zimbabwe agreed to each contribute $220 million to build the delayed $4.2 billion Batoka Gorge hydropower plant that will supply electricity to both nations.】

item.title: 炸弹气旋 "导致美国北部数千人断电
item.description: 一场冬季风暴给包括纽约在内的美国北部地区带来了强风和急剧下降的气温，导致 20 多万用户停电。【原文：A winter storm that brought intense winds and rapidly falling temperatures to the Northern US including New York has left more than 200,000 customers without electricity.】

item.title: 混合动力汽车是汽车制造商的电气化生命线
item.description: 美国电动汽车市场正面临着艰难的 2026 年。联邦优惠政策不再，汽车制造商正在取消纯电动车型，销量可能会下滑。不过，混合动力车正在崛起。车型增多，电池容量增大，销量也在上升。【原文：The US electric vehicle market is facing a tough 2026. Federal incentives are no more, automakers are canceling all-electric models and sales are likely to sag. Hybrids, though, are having a moment. There are more models, with bigger batteries, and sales are on the rise.】

item.title: Cold Snap Lifts French Power Demand to Highest Since February
item.description: Freezing weather gripping France drove up power demand to the highest since February, forcing coal-fired plants to ramp up output.

item.title: 印度法院叫停重新定义矿产丰富的阿拉瓦利山的命令
item.description: 印度最高法院已停止执行五周前下达的命令，该命令开放了矿产丰富的阿拉瓦利山丘（世界上最古老的山丘之一），以便进行更广泛的采矿和房地产开发。【原文：India’s top court has halted implementation of its five weeks-old order that opened up the mineral-rich Aravalli hills, one of the world’s oldest, for more extensive mining and real estate.】

item.title: 混合动力车型如何帮助汽车制造商的电气化计划继续推进
item.description:
由于电动汽车不再享受优惠政策，混合动力汽车的销售速度正在加快。【原文：

With EV incentives no longer available, hybrid vehicle sales are gaining speed.

】

item.title: 美国冬季风暴带来暴雪天气和危险风寒
item.description: 周一，美国中西部上部的部分地区将面临一场强烈的冬季风暴带来的暴风雪般的恶劣天气、险象环生的旅行和停电威胁，而其他地区则要为骤降的气温、强风以及冰雪和雨水的混合天气做好准备。【原文：A potent winter storm threatened blizzard-like conditions, treacherous travel and power outages in parts of the Upper Midwest as other areas of the country braced Monday for plunging temperatures, strong winds and a mix of snow, ice, and rain.】

item.title: 彭博绿色》杂志今年最受赞赏的气候报道
item.description: 做记者的一部分工作就是阅读其他刊物的无数报道，并希望自己能想到这些报道。受《商业周刊》年度 "嫉妒榜 "的启发，今天的时事通讯将为您带来我们的 "嫉妒榜"，其中包括今年令我们印象深刻的报道。此外，还有每周读物和播客。【原文：Part of being a journalist is reading countless stories from other publications and wishing you’d thought of them. Inspired by Businessweek’s annual Jealousy List, today’s newsletter brings you our Green With Envy List of the stories that stuck with us this year. Plus, your weekly read and podcast.】

item.title: 伦敦对烧木柴炉灶的热爱引发污染辩论
item.description:
烧木柴的炉灶曾被视为一种可持续发展的迷人升级方式，但现在却因其给伦敦的冬季空气污染带来的影响而备受关注。【原文：

Once seen as a sustainable and charming upgrade, wood-burning stoves are now under scrutiny for what they add to London’s polluted winter air.

】

item.title: 中国 11 月太阳能发电新增装机量升至六个月新高
item.description: 中国 11 月份的太阳能装机量飙升至六个月来的最高水平，延续了年末的复苏势头。【原文：China’s solar installations in November surged to the highest in six months, extending an end-of-year recovery.】

item.title: 绿色债务销售创历史新高
item.description: 今年，全球绿色债券销售额创下新高，部分原因是清洁电力需求和为人工智能数据中心供电的电网升级。今天的时事通讯将深入探讨 2025 年的市场表现以及好景是否会持续。【原文：Global green debt sales hit a record this year, driven in part by demand for clean power and grid upgrades to feed AI data centers. Today’s newsletter delves into how the market did in 2025 and whether the good times will last.】

item.title: 尽管气候问题引发反弹，绿色债券销售仍创下历史新高
item.description: 尽管美国和欧洲在政策和监管方面有所退步，但随着人工智能推动能源基础设施需求的蓬勃发展，投资者今年纷纷涌入气候友好型资产。【原文：Investors have piled into climate-friendly assets this year despite policy and regulatory rollbacks in the US and Europe, as artificial intelligence drives a boom in energy infrastructure demand.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔号快船将在圣诞节后为纽约带来小雪
item.description: 周五，一场被称为 "阿尔伯塔快船"（Alberta Clipper）的快速移动风暴将把冷空气推向美国东北部和大西洋中部各州，在纽约市降雪，然后在华盛顿特区转为降雨。【原文：A fast moving storm dubbed the Alberta Clipper will push freezing air into the US Northeast and mid-Atlantic states Friday, dropping snow on New York City before turning to rain in Washington, D.C.】

item.title: 2025 年的气候好消息
item.description: 你可能会认为 2025 年对气候来说都是坏消息。排放量增加了，企业在气候方面的进展放缓了，法规也减少了。但也有气候方面的胜利。【原文：You’d be forgiven for thinking 2025 was all bad news for the climate. Emissions were up, corporate climate progress slowed down and regulations were rolled back. But there were climate wins, too.】

item.title: 南加州面临圣诞洪灾的 "巨大危险
item.description: 南加州居民周三正准备应对一场强大的冬季风暴，预计这场风暴将给该地区带来危险的洪水以及岩石和泥石流，威胁到财产安全，并阻碍假日旅行计划。【原文：Residents of Southern California were bracing Wednesday for a powerful winter storm forecast to bring dangerous flooding as well as rock and mudslides to the region, threatening property and snarling holiday travel plans.】

item.title: 年末气候好消息
item.description:
今年，气候行动遭遇了重大挫折，但也取得了一些胜利。【原文：

This year brought major setbacks on climate action, but there were wins, too.

】

item.title: 核电开发商建议将海军反应堆用于数据中心
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一家电力开发商提议重新利用海军战舰上的核反应堆为美国电网供电，因为特朗普政府正努力为人工智能的蓬勃发展确保大量能源。【原文：A Texas power developer is proposing to repurpose nuclear reactors from Navy warships to supply the US grid as the Trump administration pushes to secure massive amounts of energy for the artificial intelligence boom.】
